meanings.definition: A person regarded as an inspired teacher or proclaimer of the will of God.
meanings.sent1: The ancient prophets shared wise teachings with the people.
meanings.sent2: The prophets in the Bible spoke the words of God to the believers.
meanings.sent3: The young girl jokingly called herself the family prophet after guessing the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was so sharp, she seemed like a prophet foreseeing events before they happened.
meanings.sent5: The image of the prophet standing on the mountain, delivering divine messages, stayed in their minds.

meanings.definition: A person who predicts or foretells what will happen in the future.
meanings.sent1: The weather prophet on TV said it would rain tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: Many people believe in prophets who can see into the future.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled when their friend jokingly claimed to be a prophet of upcoming test questions.
meanings.sent4: Her accurate predictions made her seem like a prophet with a crystal ball.
meanings.sent5: The prophet's words about the impending disaster echoed in their minds, warning them to prepare.
